business.headline: Nirav Modi's brother-in-law Maiank Mehta pardoned in Rs 13,000 crore PNB scam caseA special CBI court granted pardon to Maiank Mehta, brother-in-law of fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi, in the Rs 13,000 crore Punjab National Bank fraud case.

What to expect from the National Stock Exchange in the next 5 years?Ashish Chauhan, CEO of NSE Chauhan, said the rise in investors and market size over the last decade gives a clear idea of the potential ahead. In 2014, India had just 1.67 crore unique investors. Today, there are about 12 crore investors.

50% tariffs and growth: Why India must focus on reform, not retaliationAt the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts called for reforms, investment-led growth, and targeted support for vulnerable sectors to navigate challenges from steep US tariffs.

Explained: Why Dalal Street has an edge over global stock marketsAt the India Today Conclave in Mumbai, Ashish Chauhan, CEO of the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE), explained why India's markets and economy hold a stronger position for the future compared to others.

From 50% tariffs to growth: Why India needs reforms, not retaliationAs the US slaps steep tariffs on Indian goods, the debate is shifting from retaliation to reform. Experts at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025 say India should use this moment to push for deeper reforms that fuel investment and boost domestic demand.
How to invest in pharma and IT stocks during current slowdownWith the US announcing fresh tariffs on branded drugs and uncertainty around H-1B visa rules, both sectors are experiencing headwinds.

India-US trade talks advance amid tariff and energy discussionsIndia-US trade discussions are gaining momentum, with both nations exploring ways to enhance economic cooperation, address tariffs, and boost energy trade.

Sensex tumbles 733 points as pharma, IT stocks hitThe sell-off came after the United States announced a steep 100% tariff on imports of branded and patented pharmaceutical products, effective October 1.

Indian air passengers rise to 131.7 lakh in August 2025 amid rising costs: ReportIndia's aviation sector is bouncing back, but the journey isn't without turbulence. Rising fuel costs, operational challenges, and financial pressures are testing airlines, even as passenger traffic shows steady growth.

Sensex tanks 800 points: Why is stock market falling today?By 2:37 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex had lost 782.71 points to trade at 80,376.97, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 247.10 points to 24,643.75. Both indices were on track to end the week in negative territory.

Investors brace for IPO wave as 18 public listings hit Dalal Street next weekThe four mainboard IPOs opening next week together aim to raise over Rs 850 crore. Apart from them, 14 SME IPOs will also open for bidding next week.

Why more insurance policyholders are turning to private grievance platformsAs claim rejections soar and official channels frustrate, policyholders turn to private grievance platforms. Experts warn regulatory reform and competent brokers could restore trust in India's struggling insurance system.

entertainment.headline: Vijay Karur rally stampede: Kamal Haasan, Rajinikanth, celebs extend condolences The Karur rally tragedy has deeply saddened Tamil Nadu, with the film fraternity expressing shock and grief over the loss of 39 lives, including children, due to overcrowding and poor arrangements. Rajinikanth, Kamal Haasan, and other celebs mourned the loss of lives.

Selena Gomez-Benny Blanco are married, singer shares dreamy photos Singer-actor Selena Gomez has married her longtime boyfriend and record producer Benny Blanco in an intimate wedding ceremony in Santa Barbara, California. She shared stunning pictures from the private celebration held on September 27, 2025.

Ahaan Panday in Sanjay Leela Bhansali film? Actor visits filmmaker, sparks buzz Bollywood's rising star Ahaan Panday was seen at Sanjay Leela Bhansali's office on Saturday, sparking widespread speculation about a potential collaboration between the two. Fans are eagerly awaiting an official announcement as excitement builds over this possible new project.

Varalaxmi Sarathkumar's directorial debut Saraswathi to star Priyamani, Prakash Raj Varalaxmi Sarathkumar is making her directorial debut with 'Saraswathi', produced under the new banner Dosa Diaries launched with her sister Pooja. The actor shared the announcement post on Saturday.

Ajith Kumar talks about dream F1 film collaboration and his racing passion Tamil superstar Ajith Kumar hinted at the possibility of making a Formula One film, blending his passion for racing with cinema. In an interview with India Today, he also expressed hope for an Indian driver to become a Formula One World Champion in his lifetime.

Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco's wedding: Date, guest list, what we know so far Set against the scenic backdrop of Santa Barbara, Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco are set for a secret, celebrity-filled wedding that promises to be intimate, unforgettable, and all that one can talk about. Here's all we know about D-Day so far.

Bigg Boss 19: Amaal Mallik is scolded by Salman Khan and Gauahar; watch promo In the upcoming 'Bigg Boss 19' Weekend Ka Vaar, Salman Khan scolded Amaal Mallik for his abusive behaviour and urged him to focus on his talent. Former winner Gauahar Khan also entered the house to give Amaal and Awez Darbar a reality check.

PVR's Aamer Bijli on bringing Shin-Chan to India, nostalgia, and anime obsession PVR Inox Pictures is bringing the beloved anime 'Shin-Chan' to Indian cinemas with 'Kasukabe Dancers'. The film's extensive localisation and nostalgic appeal aim to capture audiences across tier 2 and 3 cities, signalling growing anime popularity in India.

Shraddha Kapoor announces Choti Stree, animated spin-off from horror-comedy saga Shraddha Kapoor announced 'Choti Stree', an animated film from Maddock's horror-comedy universe that will explore the backstory of her iconic character. Producer Dinesh Vijan shared it will connect directly to 'Stree 3', releasing six months before the live-action sequel.

Jr NTR's Devara 2 announced on first film's anniversary On the first anniversary of 'Devara', the makers have confirmed the much-awaited sequel, 'Devara 2', thrilling fans across the nation. The original film's gripping storyline and Jr NTR's powerful dual roles have set high expectations for the upcoming action-packed continuation.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 34: Farrhana wins captaincy, Gaurav fumes over unfair decision In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19', Farrhana Bhatt defeated Gaurav Khanna to become the new captain of the house. The loss didn't sit well with Gaurav, who lashed out at the opposition team, demanding fair play and transparency in the game.

Lokah 2 first look: Tovino Thomas takes superhero saga ahead, Dulquer Salmaan joins The Lokah universe is set to expand with the official announcement of 'Lokah Chapter 2', featuring Tovino Thomas and Dulquer Salmaan in a darker, thrilling sequel. Following the massive success of 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra', fans can expect an ambitious continuation of India's biggest Malayalam superhero saga.

Exclusive: Namashi Chakraborty feels Bollywood needs talent, not surnames Actor Namashi Chakraborty, who recently featured in director Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Bengal Files', shared his views on opportunities for young talent, in an interview with IndiaToday.in. He also spoke about his actor father Mithun Chakraborty, films based on real events and more.

Nani's The Paradise: Mohan Babu is fierce in first look as Shikanja Maalik Mohan Babu is making a powerful comeback as the menacing villain Shikanja Maalik in Nani's upcoming multi-language film 'The Paradise'. The film, directed by Srikanth Odela, is set for a global release in March 2026.

Lady Gaga celebrates partner Michael Polansky's 42nd birthday with romantic tribute Lady Gaga celebrated her partner Michael Polansky's 42nd birthday with heartfelt post, calling it her favourite day of the year and praising his achievements. She also expressed gratitude for his support in her personal life and career, including their shared journey with her fans.

The Social Reckoning: The Social Network sequel set to open on October 9, 2026 Aaron Sorkin is making a comeback with 'The Social Reckoning', a sequel to his 2010 hit 'The Social Network', exploring Facebook's recent turbulent history. The film will spotlight whistleblower Frances Haugen and the controversies that have shaped the social media giant in the last decade.

Are Thursday film premieres shaking up Indian cinema's old rulebook? Indian cinema is shifting gears as Thursday premieres rise alongside the classic Friday release, giving films a longer weekend run. Fuelled by fan frenzy and box office strategy, the trend signals flexibility, but without erasing Friday's cultural pull.

Papon remembers late Zubeen Garg with throwback photo, urges for fast investigation Papon paid tribute to late singer Zubeen Garg, sharing memories and calling for a swift investigation into his death. Meanwhile, manager Siddhartha Sharma clarified the ownership of Garg's songs, confirming that earnings from his later works will go to his family.

Exclusive: Giddh's Radhika Lavu on National Award, cinema, survival, Sanjay Mishra National Award-winning filmmaker Radhika Lavu opens up about her short film 'Giddh - The Scavenger', starring Sanjay Mishra. In an exclusive interview, she reflects on cinema, survival, the female gaze, and what her win means for independent and regional storytellers in India.

general news.headline: Asia Cup final: Did Suryakumar mock Pakistan one game too early?India vs Pakistan, Asia Cup final: Suryakumar Yadav's blunt words may sound confident, but against Pakistan they can do more harm than good. In a rivalry where every comment becomes fuel, the only answer that matters will come from his bat, not from what he says before the first ball is bowled.

Delhi 'godman', accused of molesting 17 students at ashram, arrested from AgraSwami Chaitanyananda Saraswati, who served as the director of the Sri Sharada Institute of Indian Management-Research in Delhi, went into hiding after more than 15 women students studying in the institute accused him of abusive language, unwanted physical contact, and sending obscene messages.

One nation openly declares terror as state policy: S Jaishankar tears into Pak at UN At the UN, India's S Jaishankar called Pakistan an "epicentre of global terrorism," cited the Pahalgam attack, and urged global action to choke terror financing, condemn state-backed terror, and uphold shared security.

India vs Pakistan final: Asia Cup ready for coronation without handshakesIndia vs Pakistan, Asia Cup final: Forty-one years after the inaugural Asia Cup, India and Pakistan face off in the final for the first time. Although India won their two earlier encounters comfortably, the cricket has been overshadowed by snubs, heated exchanges, and provocative gestures. This Asia Cup looks set to crown a champion without any handshakes between the finalists.

The 260-year-old Durga that refused to move for immersion in Shiva's KashiImmersion of idols on Vijayadashami caps Durga Puja celebrations every year. However, in Varanasi's Madanpura, it's the same clay idol that has been being worshipped for almost 260 years now. Legend has it that in 1767, the Durga idol at Bengali Tola refused to move when people tried to take it out for immersion.

Video: Boxer Mary Kom's Faridabad home robbed, thieves flee with TV, valuablesCCTV footage from the night of the incident shows suspicious individuals carrying items, including a television set, and other valuables from the house. The footage is currently being reviewed by authorities.

My heart is shattered: TVK's Vijay breaks silence, condoles Karur stampede deathsAt least 38 people, including women and children, died in the stampede. Several people fainted at the heavily overcrowded rally as the crowd went out of control.

3 killed in North Carolina after gunman opens fire at restaurant from boat: CopsA gunman opened fire at a popular restaurant from a boat in North Carolina's Southport. According to police, seven people were shot, of whom 3 died on the spot.

Selena Gomez-Benny Blanco are married, singer shares dreamy photosSinger-actor Selena Gomez has married her longtime boyfriend and record producer Benny Blanco in an intimate wedding ceremony in Santa Barbara, California. She shared stunning pictures from the private celebration held on September 27, 2025.

Accenture lays off 11,000 employees, warns more job cuts are coming due to AIAccenture cuts over 11,000 jobs in three months amid a major AI-focused restructuring. The move signals a shift towards automation but raises concerns about the future of human expertise.
Shashi Tharoor has little sympathy for idli critics. His reply to X user goes viralShashi Tharoor used all poetic words when replying to an X user who said idli tastes like 'steamed regret.'

Heavy rain alert in Mumbai, NDRF on standby; airline issues travel advisoryAccording to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), the island city recorded 30.07 mm of rainfall in the 24 hours ending at 8 am.

From boycott calls to cinema halls: Asia Cup final to be screened across IndiaIndia vs Pakistan Asia Cup final will be screened live in over 100 cinema halls across India on Sunday, September 28. From boycott calls to cinema halls, the continental tournament has been an emotional roller-coaster for fans.
Video: Chaos as ferris wheel tilts at temple fair, riders left hanging mid-airPolice and locals quickly evacuated all riders, and no injuries were reported. Authorities have since removed the swing.

Bareilly tense after cleric's arrest over 'I Love Muhammad' clash, internet shutTauqeer Raza, a local cleric and chief of the Ittehad-e-Millat Council, was arrested on Saturday after his call to protest in support of the 'I Love Muhammad' campaign sparked unrest in Bareilly.

Bharat will maintain freedom of choice: Jaishankar takes veiled swipe at US, ChinaIn an apparent attack on both the United States and China, Jaishankar accused wealthy nations of hypocrisy in global trade and selective responses to crises.

Noida man says his daughter won't 'glorify' struggle at 21. Viral post sparks debateWe all remember the stories our fathers and grandfathers told us about the struggles they endured to provide us with what we have today. Yes, they had to struggle, and they did it for us. But why should the next generation be chasing salaries at 21? This is what a Noida-based man wrote in his now-viral post, which has since left the internet divided.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's recent post breaks the internet once againVirat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's latest Instagram post has gone viral, racking up millions of likes within hours. Fans are loving their candid family moments, as the couple continues setting new social media benchmarks worldwide.

Gross negligence: Annamalai slams DMK government over Vijay rally stampedeThe former Tamil Nadu BJP chief demanded a fair and thorough investigation into the causes of the stampede, and sought compensation for the families of the victims.

Why prediabetes should be treated with same urgency as diabetes in IndiaPrediabetes is becoming a major health challenge in India, especially among young adults. Early screening and preventive treatments like metformin could reduce future diabetes burden.

Trump as demon idol steals spotlight at Bengal puja pandal amid trade disputeThe portrayal reflects grievances over trade policies, including tariffs imposed on India, which the committee views as detrimental to the country's interests.

Ahaan Panday in Sanjay Leela Bhansali film? Actor visits filmmaker, sparks buzzBollywood's rising star Ahaan Panday was seen at Sanjay Leela Bhansali's office on Saturday, sparking widespread speculation about a potential collaboration between the two. Fans are eagerly awaiting an official announcement as excitement builds over this possible new project.

Asia Cup final: Pakistan captain breaks silence on no handshake saga vs IndiaAsia Cup final, India vs Pakistan: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha has broken his silence on the 'no handshake' controversy against India ahead of the Asia Cup final in Dubai.

sports.headline: Can Pakistan ride on law of averages to ruffle high-flying India? Asia Cup Final, IND vs PAK: Pakistan have lost seven matches on the trot against India, and will look to end their losing streak when they play in the grand finale on Sunday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Arundhati Reddy returns with spirited spell vs New Zealand after freak injury Indian fast bowler Arundhati Reddy shook off injury concerns with a sharp spell against New Zealand, giving India a timely boost before the Women's World Cup, starting September 30.

Top 10 most memorable India vs Pakistan cricket matches of all time For the first time in 41 years, India and Pakistan will face each other in an Asia Cup final, setting the stage for a historic clash in Dubai. Over the past four decades, the two arch-rivals have met in 9 tournament finals, with India managing to secure just three victories.

Women's World Cup: Can Fatima Sana put Pakistan on the global map? Women's World Cup: Pakistan enter the tournament aiming more for experience than titles, relying on key performers like Fatima Sana, Sidra Amin, and their spin duo Nashra Sandhu and Sadia Iqbal to challenge stronger sides.

From boycott calls to cinema halls: Asia Cup final to be screened across India India vs Pakistan Asia Cup final will be screened live in over 100 cinema halls across India on Sunday, September 28. From boycott calls to cinema halls, the continental tournament has been an emotional roller-coaster for fans.

Fans are loving their candid family moments, as the couple continues setting new social media benchmarks worldwide.

India yet to play complete game, but needs perfection vs Pakistan in final India's record in the Asia Cup has been perfect, but their game has been far from perfect. With continental success on offer and aiming to stamp their authority before the T20 World Cup, India will need to produce the perfect game.

India vs Pakistan, Asia Cup final: Suryakumar Yadav's blunt words may sound confident, but against Pakistan they can do more harm than good. In a rivalry where every comment becomes fuel, the only answer that matters will come from his bat, not from what he says before the first ball is bowled.

India vs Pakistan Asia Cup final: Tickets sold out for Dubai summit clash Dubai gears up for a historic Asia Cup final as India faces Pakistan. With all 28,000 tickets sold out, fans are ready for an electric clash marking the first-ever summit meeting between the rivals.

Don't put pressure on Suryakumar: Ashwin backs India captain before Pak final India's Asia Cup final against Pakistan places Suryakumar Yadav under scrutiny, but R Ashwin urges calm. With his aggressive brand of T20 cricket, Surya could still turn the tide and lead India to glory.

Although India won their two earlier encounters comfortably, the cricket has been overshadowed by snubs, heated exchanges, and provocative gestures. This Asia Cup looks set to crown a champion without any handshakes between the finalists.

India predicted XI for final vs Pakistan: Is Hardik Pandya fit for big clash?India and Pakistan are set to meet for the first time in an Asia Cup final on September 28 in Dubai. Hardik Pandya's injury raises questions over India's final playing XI and strategy.

Nepal stun West Indies in 1st T20I, register first-ever win over full-member sideNepal recorded their first-ever international win against an ICC full-member side as they beat West Indies by 19 runs in the first T20I at Sharjah. Rohit Paudel was adjudged Player of the Match for his innings of 38 off 35 and figures of 1/20 with the ball.

Julian Alvarez stars as Atletico Madrid thrash Real Madrid 5-2 in derbyJulian Alvarez scored twice as Atletico Madrid triumphed 5-2 over Real Madrid in a thrilling Madrid derby. The result ended Real's perfect start to the season and gave Atletico a major boost in their LaLiga campaign.

INDW vs NZW: Harmanpreet helps India secure comfortable win in warm-up clashHarleen Deol and captain Harmanpreet Kaur both scored half-centuries as India Women comfortably chased down the target to secure a four-wicket victory (DLS) over New Zealand in their second and final Women's World Cup warm-up match in Bengaluru.

Liverpool suffer their first loss, Chelsea fall while Manchester City cruisesPremier League champions Liverpool suffered their first loss of the season, going down 2-1 to Crystal Palace in the eighth minute of added time, while Manchester United and Chelsea also fell 3-1 on Saturday.

Pakistan have saved their best for Asia Cup final: Salman Agha warns IndiaPakistan captain Salman Ali Agha believes his team has "saved their best" for Sunday's Asia Cup final against India. Despite losing their previous two encounters against India in Dubai, Salman expressed confidence that Pakistan could turn the tide in the high-pressure clash.

Shailesh Kumar wins gold as India shines at World Para Athletics in New DelhiShailesh Kumar and Varun Singh Bhati opened India's medal account at the World Para Athletics Championships on Saturday, claiming gold and bronze respectively in the men's high jump T63 event.

One good innings or spell can change course: Wasim Akram hopes for an upset vs IndiaAsia Cup 2025: Wasim Akram believes India remain favourites, but Pakistan could cause an upset in the Asia Cup 2025 final. The high-stakes India-Pakistan clash in Dubai could turn into a classic T20 battle.

Liverpool suffer their first loss, Chelsea fall while Manchester City cruisesPremier League champions Liverpool suffered their first loss of the season, going down 2-1 to Crystal Palace in the eighth minute of added time, while Manchester United and Chelsea also fell 3-1 on Saturday.

Pakistan have saved their best for Asia Cup final: Salman Agha warns IndiaPakistan captain Salman Ali Agha believes his team has "saved their best" for Sunday's Asia Cup final against India. Despite losing their previous two encounters against India in Dubai, Salman expressed confidence that Pakistan could turn the tide in the high-pressure clash.

Shailesh Kumar wins gold as India shines at World Para Athletics in New DelhiShailesh Kumar and Varun Singh Bhati opened India's medal account at the World Para Athletics Championships on Saturday, claiming gold and bronze respectively in the men's high jump T63 event.

One good innings or spell can change course: Wasim Akram hopes for an upset vs IndiaAsia Cup 2025: Wasim Akram believes India remain favourites, but Pakistan could cause an upset in the Asia Cup 2025 final. The high-stakes India-Pakistan clash in Dubai could turn into a classic T20 battle.

Pakistan's Salman Agha confident of best show vs India in Asia Cup finalPakistan captain Salman Ali Agha was confident that his side would rise to the occasion and deliver their best performance against arch-rivals India in the high-pressure Asia Cup final in Dubai. "We can't control what's happening outside; we can only control the controllables. And that is winning the Asia Cup," he added.

If someone wants to be aggressive, why not? Salman Agha gives free hand vs IndiaAsia Cup 2025: Pakistan captain, Salman Ali Agha, revealed that he will give his players a free hand to showcase aggression when on the field. This sparks concerns, considering his side will meet India in the title clash on Sunday.

Asia Cup final: Pakistan captain breaks silence on no handshake saga vs IndiaAsia Cup final, India vs Pakistan: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha has broken his silence on the 'no handshake' controversy against India ahead of the Asia Cup final in Dubai.

SL thriller good wake-up call for India before Asia Cup final vs Pakistan: GavaskarBatting great Sunil Gavaskar, while speaking to India Today, said that playing a high-intensity thriller against Sri Lanka just a day before the Asia Cup final against Pakistan could serve as a valuable wake-up call for India. The Men in Blue will face their arch-rivals in what promises to be a high-stakes encounter.

Manchester United given harsh reality-check with crushing 3-0 loss to BrentfordManchester United were defeated 3-1 by Brentford with Igor Thiago scoring twice. The loss highlights United's ongoing struggles and defensive lapses under Ruben Amorim.

Amit Mishra blasts India for poor fielding in Asia Cup: What is the coach doing?Amit Mishra has criticised the Indian cricket team for their poor fielding in the Asia Cup 2025. India have dropped nine catches in the tournament so far.

Asia Cup: ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi to present trophy, India's stance remains unclearAsia Cup 2025: ACC chairman Mohsin Naqvi is set to present the Asia Cup 2025 trophy in the final between India and Pakistan. His presence raises questions over India's response amid ongoing tensions and past controversies.

Arshdeep Singh reveals Super Over plan, not worried about lack of game timeIndia pacer Arshdeep Singh attributed his Super Over success against Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup Super 4s to his ability to consistently deliver wide yorkers.

No Meg Lanning, but Australia stay firm favourites for eighth titleWomen's World Cup : Australia's batting and bowling firepower, combined with relentless adaptability and consistency, makes them overwhelming favourites for an eighth title in 2025.

West Ham sack coach Graham Potter after poor run of results in Premier LeagueGraham Potter's tenure as West Ham head coach ended after just nine months, with poor results prompting the club to act in hopes of Premier League survival.

Easwaran dropped from team due to father's strong statements: Kris SrikkanthFormer cricketer Kris Srikkanth suggests Abhimanyu Easwaran's removal from the Test squad is linked to his father's critical comments. Easwaran didn't play a single match on the England tour and has been dropped for West Indies series.

Sheetal Devi crowned world champion, bags historic gold at Para World Archery C'shipSheetal Devi won gold in the women's compound individual event at the Para World Archery Championship. Her victory over Turkiye's top-ranked archer highlights India's rising strength in para-archery.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
